page.title: 05THE OLD SCHOOL OF ALKHAM
page.content: Up until July l972 Alkham had its own primary school. The building, constructed in 1865 of flint and brick, consisted of two rooms, including a large infant room which had once contained three classes. A toilet block was built later. A small playground occupied the area in front of the school. Vicarage Meadow was used for games lessons and sports days. School meals were transported from Lydden school and eaten in the Village Hall where a small kitchen had been built for the use of the School Meals Service. School concerts and Christmas parties also took place in the Hall. At the time of closure one full-time and two half-time teachers were employed at the school. Twenty-five children were attending the school drawn from Alkham, Ewell Minnis and Drellingore.
